Title: Student loan: NELFUND kicks as institutions hike tuition fees, charges for profit
Summary: The Nigerian Education Loan Fund (NELFUND) has expressed concern over the astronomical increase in tuition fees by some institutions, ranging between 20 and 521 per cent .

Title: Brands must leverage sustainability for greater ROI, reveals expert
Summary: Nigerian brands have been told to imbibe sustainability as a marketing strategy to attract conscious consumers . Brands must leverage sustainability for greater ROI, reveals expert .

Title: U.S. pressure triggers FG, Senate pushback on alleged Christian persecution
Summary: Facing mounting U.S. pressure over alleged ‘Christian genocide’, Nigeria’s government and lawmakers are working to correct what they call a misleading narrative . The portrayal distorts facts, risks sanctions, and weakens diplomacy by ignoring the wider causes of insecurity across all communities .

Title: We must project our stories or risk being defined by others, says Mba
Summary: We must project our stories or risk being defined by others, says Mba . Emeka Mba has observed narrative power shapes how outsiders perceive a country .

Title: Certificate scandal: Mbah behind my ordeals, Nnaji claims
Summary: Minister of Innovation, Science and Technology, Geoffrey Nnaji, has accused the Governor of Enugu State, Peter Mbah, of sponsoring allegations of certificate forgery against him .

Title: FG won’t renew licences of poor-performing DisCos in 2028 – Adelabu
Summary: The Minister of Power, Chief Adebayo Adelabu, said the Federal Government will not renew licences of poorly performing electricity distribution companies when they expire in 2028 . He blamed the DisCos for poor-performing DisCos .

Title: FG set to eliminate multiple budgetary operations
Summary: The Federal Government may have concluded plan to phase out multiple budget fiscal operations . The multiple budgetary fiscal operations entail implementation of more than one Appropriation Acts simultaneously .

Title: CBN imposes N5m fine on illegal agent banking activities
Summary: CBN imposes N5m fine on illegal agent banking activities . Any agent found engaging in non-permissible activities will face a minimum penalty of N5 million for the offence and N100,000 for each day the default continues . CBN also forfeits any profit made from such activities .

Title: IBOM AIR SAGA: My gesture to Emmanson misunderstood – Ossai Success
Summary: Ibom Air flight from Uyo landed safely in Lagos on August 10, but an altercation between a flight attendant and Comfort Emmanson drew public attention . Ossai Success denied allegations of promoting unruly behaviour .
